definitions.definition: Of, relating to, or being the person or entity after which someone or something is named ; serving as an eponym .
examples: Prince Hamlet is the eponymous protagonist of the Shakespearian tragedy Hamlet .
Robinson Crusoe is the eponymous hero of the book.
The language Limburgish is named after the eponymous provinces in Belgium and the Netherlands.

definitions.definition: Of a thing : named after a person or entity.
examples: The American singer-songwriter Madonna released her eponymous album in 1983.

main_definition: Of, relating to, or being the person or entity after which someone or something is named ; serving as an eponym .
secondary_definitions: Of a thing : named after a person or entity.
